image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

profileText: A Representative from West Virginia; born in Cadiz, Harrison County, Ohio, on January 23, 1901; attended the public schools; A.B., Bethany College, Bethany, W.Va., 1924; principal of Warwood High School in Wheeling, W.Va., 1926-1929; J.D., West Virginia University Law School, Morgantown, W.Va., 1932; was admitted to the bar the same year and commenced practice in Wheeling, W.Va.; elected as a Republican to the Eightieth Congress (January 3, 1947-January 3, 1949); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the Eighty-first Congress in 1948; resumed the general practice of law; delegate to Republican National Conventions in 1956, 1960, 1964, and 1968; died on October 30, 1989, in Wheeling, W.Va.
